*2018-03-12*

# Formal Verification of DSToken ERC20 Token Contract

We present a formal verification of [DSToken ERC20][token] token contract.

The DSToken ERC20 token is a high-profile ERC20 token contract written in Solidity implemented by [DappHub](https://dapphub.com/).

We found that the DSToken ERC20 token deviates from the [ERC20-K] (and thus [ERC20-EVM]) specification as follows:

* *Stoppable modifier*: It uses the stoppable modifier inherited from [`DSStop`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-stop/tree/32fffeb2142cb34b71d8a7914f784244b44d1ede), which if it is set to true by the owner of the token it throws exception in `transfer`, `transferFrom` and `approve`. 

## Target Smart Contract

The target contract of our formal verification is the following, where we took the Solidity source code from the Github repository,
https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token,
commit [`bb98ff`][version]:
* [token.sol][token] which inherits [base.sol][base]

We formally verified the full functional correctness of the following ERC20 functions:

* [`totalSupply`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L27) - inherited from DSTokenBase
* [`balanceOf`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L30) - inherited from DSTokenBase
* [`allowance`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L33) - inherited from DSTokenBase
* [`approve`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/token.sol#L35) - extending [`approve`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L61) of DSTokenBase
* [`transfer`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/token.sol#L27) - extending [`transfer`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L37) of DSTokenBase
* [`transferFrom`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/token.sol#L30) - extending [`transferFrom`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-token/blob/bb98ff4841e82137efc9690b9e1cf77e85fdd0bb/src/base.sol#L48) of DSTokenBase

## Verification Artifacts

### Solidity Source Code and Compiled EVM Bytecode

We took the source code of [DSToken][token] and [DSTokenBase][base] and the additional libraries [`DSAuth`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-auth/tree/ce62361903fbf085c94c82c885c7ae393c95749e), [`DSMath`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-math/tree/228177aa957f87ac6f9bb6a97b64a7912441323a), [`DSStop`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-stop/tree/32fffeb2142cb34b71d8a7914f784244b44d1ede) and [`DSNote`](https://github.com/dapphub/ds-note/tree/8bc2e258055516dde772013212893266bc9d6449), and compiled it to the EVM bytecode using solc compiler (of the version `0.4.18+commit.9cf6e910.Linux.g++`).

The EVM (runtime) bytecode generated by the solc compiler is the following:

* [token.bytes](token.bytes)

The (annotated) EVM assembly disassembled from the bytecode is the following:

* [token.evm](token.evm)

### Mechanized Specifications and Proofs

Due to its deviation from [ERC20-K], we could not verify the DSToken ERC20 token against the original [ERC20-EVM] specification. In order to show that it is "correct" w.r.t. ERC20-K (thus ERC20-EVM) modulo the deviation, we modified the specification to capture the deviation and successfully verified it against the modified ERC20-EVM specification. Below are the changes made to the original ERC20-EVM specification:

* To capture the stoppable modifier from `transfer`, `transferFrom` and `approve`, we added the following variable in `storage`

    ```
    #hashedLocation({COMPILER}, {_STOPPED}, .IntList) |-> STOPPED
    ```

	We have added also the following in `required` for the succes case:

    ```
    andBool STOPPED ==Int 0 
    ```

    and its complement for the failure cases:

    ```
    andBool STOPPED ==Int 1 <<Int (20 *Int 8)
    ```

The full changes made in ERC20-EVM are shown in [here](spec-diff.patch). The specifications of other functions except `transfer`, `transferFrom` and `approve` are the same as the original ERC20-EVM.

We took the modified [ERC20-EVM] specification and instantiated it with the [program-specific parameters] shown below.

```
[pgm]
compiler: "Solidity"
_supply: 0
_balances: 1
_allowances: 2
_stopped: 4
code: ""
gasCap: 100000
```

The resulting specification is the following:

* [ds-token-erc20-spec.ini](ds-token-erc20-spec.ini)

The specification is written in [eDSL], a domain-specific language for EVM specifications, whose good understanding is required in order to understand any of our EVM-level specification well.  Refer to [resources] for background on our technology.  The above file provides the [eDSL] specification template parameters, the full K reachability logic specification being automatically derived from a specification template by instantiating it with the template parameters.

Run the following command in the root directory of this repository, and it will generate the full specification under the directory `specs/ds-token-erc20`:

```
$ make ds-token-erc20
```

Run the EVM verifier to prove that the specification is satisfied by (the compiled EVM bytecode of) the target functions.
See this [instructions] for more details of running the verifier.
